text: An isolated white farmhouse set within dense pine forest. CAPTION: 21st July 2011. 90 miles east of Oslo. *
A man (early 30s) fills industrial sacks with thick black powder. Diesel soaked fertiliser mixed with aluminium. Me work. This is ANDERS BREIVIK and he is preparing for war. *
A small island on the eastern flank of LAKE TYRIFJORDEN, miles from NORWAY’S capital city, OSLO.

The early evening ferry from the mainland. Crowds of excited teenagers arrive for the annual summer run by Norway’s ruling Labour Party. Among them: VILJAR HANSSEN (17), a striking young man and to all his friends natural leader. With him, his younger brother TORJE (14). They are met off the boat by MOTHER UTOYA (45). She has r the camp for 20 years.
Welcome back!
Hey! * The boys head on up to the centre of the island. Stopping a check-in desk. *
Viljar Hanssen... *
BREIVIK loads the sacks into the white van. Next the detonator and charges - which he packs in with pieces of mattress. Then he threads a long black wire from the sacks into the driver's compartment.
VILJAR and TORJE arrive at the campsite. Make-shift signs: Oslo; Finnmark; Nordland... They come f Northern Norway, so they make for the Troms & Svalbard ca
(as the brothers approach) I think I see them... Viljar! We saved a spot for you. Viljar sees his best friends - Simon and Anders (both 17)
Perfect! They hug and begin pitching their tents.
So you brought a sleeping bag with you this time?
Yeah... my parents packed it. All around: excitement at the weekend ahead.
BREIVIK loading a black peli-case: A Glock. A rifle. A shotgun. Thousands of rounds of ammunition. Grenades. He exits the farmhouse with the peli-case and drives away
Angle on Norway’s government buildings clustered together the middle of the city, with a view of the harbour.
Prime Minister, here is your agenda for the weekend. Saturday you will visit the AUF summer camp on Utgya. For your speech...
Angle through the window: Oslo skyline with PM STOLTENBER soft left of frame.
Prime Minister, here is your agenda for the weekend. Saturday, you’re visiting the AUF summer camp on Uteya. Attached is a draft of your speech... PM reads draft.
I've started with your personal connection to the island. How it inspired your activism, and then you push on to the issues...

(scanning) OK... I think it needs to be a bit more personal. More about my memories of the camp. And then I want to really address the challenge of youth unemployment. Can you get the latest stats over to me tonight, and I’1l re-draft and bring it in tomorrow.
Yep.
(to AIDE 3) And make sure we schedule enough time for me to meet with the kids... two hours maybe?
+e
Of course.
And those committee papers are in your briefcase. You should read them before Monday.
The oil sector papers?
Right. (to AIDE 3) Make sure he gets to them on Sunday. They’re pushing for a response.
Got it. Okay I think we’re all set. Well have a good weekend. Make sure you all get some rest.
Will do thanks. Enjoy the island. Hopefully the weather will improve.. PM walks away towards the door with AIDE 3.
You have National Security at 10 in the morning, Sir. They move out into a corridor.
I'll do it in the Residency. Bring the Justice Minister earlier. (to office off screen) Have a good night.
Goodnight Prime Minister.
Thank you.
(into radio) Coming down now. PM into lift.
+e
See you back here after lunch.
Good night, Sir. The lift doors closes.
PM crosses the lobby. Past a SECURITY GUARD.
Night, Tor.
Good night, Prime Minister. The GUARD watches him walk out to his waiting car. down by the burdens of power. INT. PRIME MINISTER’S CAR - EVENING See PM alone on the backseat.
A campfire. Music, socialising. VILJAR, TORJE, SIMON and ANDERS around a fire pit. strumming a guitar. We see LARA RASHID (16) and her siste BANO (18) too.
BREIVIK on the road towards OSLO.
9 Weighed
11 12 13 14 EXT. WEST OSLO - BREIVIK’S MOTHER’S APARTMENT - NIGHT 11 He pulls up outside an apartment complex, in an up-market part of Oslo.

BREIVIK comes out of the bathroom, freshly showered. LATER: BREIVIK and his mother eating dinner in front of t TV: economic stagnation and the fall-out from the 2008 banking crisis. Europe's growing migrant crisis.
How is the farm?
It’s good. A lot of work.
I’ve been thinking, it must be lonely up there...
I see people every day.
Good.
(gets up) I have an errand.
Angle from a window: Breivik into a small Fiat Diablo. His mother watching him from behind the curtain, as he dr away in the Fiat.
Caption: 22 July 2011
15 A sailing boat cuts through the water.
GEIR LIPPESTAD (40s) a criminal lawyer, making coffee on stove. His daughter REBEKAH(15)(in a wheelchair) watches. Other around.
Ready to get home? REBEKAH’s eyes light up. LIPPESTAD (CONT’D) (smiling) Me too.
LIPPESTAD comes up onto deck. Sees SIGNE, his wife. Hands the coffee.
Better not...
No?
Looks like I can’t drink coffee for a while...
(finally gets it) Really?
Really. He starts laughing. They hug.
Oh my God. How did that happen?  16
(laughing) You've forgotten?
I need to get cases reassigned. I really want to take time off this time. They round the headland towards Oslo.
VILJAR wakes. Sees the rain. Wakes Torje next to him. They walk over to Simon and Anders’ tent.
Where did you get to last night?
Swimming. With some girls from Finnmark.

(laughs ) Swimming? With the enemy? They walk across the campsite to the canteen. We catch a glimpse of PM Stoltenberg’s photo, advertising his speech the island tomorrow. Viljar checks the seminar noticeboard. See: ‘If I was PM. and ‘Volunteering in Africa’ etc.
(reading) First seminar at 10. Football at 3.
Finnmark’s big guy at the back is out.
How do you know that?
Skinny-dipping. With the enemy.
+e  Laughter as they head into the canteen.

17 INT. BREIVIK’S BEDROOM - MOTHER’S APARTMENT - MORNING BREIVIK at his computer. Writing an email: Consider this my personal gift to all Europeans. Anders Behring Breivik. BREIVIK’S MOTHER (V.O.) Breakfast. *
Leave it outside the door. BREIVIK swallows a couple of pills. Highlights a file: * “2083: A European Declaration of Independence.” Presses “Send all”

OK, good morning everyone... Today is the first seminar. We'll start with a little exercise, that I call ‘If I was President.’ What would you do - change about the world. Viljar you can start. + eH HH
VILJAR laughs and then goes up to the stage.
OK, so in Svalbard everyone is welcome, regardless of nationality. We've got Norwegians, Russians, Chinese, Croatians. All living and working together.
Yes, but you only have a couple thousand people, how does that translate across Europe? LARA and BANO enter. VILJAR sees. *  10.
It’s the principle. Thats what’s important and if I was Prime Minister, that’s what I’d stand for...
19 INT. PM’S RESIDENCY - STUDY - DAY 19 PM STOLTENBERG is mid-way through a security briefing wit

head_text.subj: THE PST DIRECTOR, SECURITY OFFICIAL LARS, PM AIDE 2 OYSTE

text: and SECURITY OFFICIAL 2 ENDRE.

Unrest in the Middle East continues. More Islamist terror, of course. But our main issue is going to be the resulting refugee crisis. The UNHCR is now forecasting a massive surge in migrant numbers trying to reach Europe. Angle on the document: huge migrant figures from the Midd East and North Africa.
Potentially what - several million * over the next five years? *
Easily. It depends on political * instability in the Middle East. * Syria etc.. *
And the challenge is going to be * how we protect inclusive domestic * policies with numbers like these. *
And it’s going to hit us right as * we deal with the fallout from the * banking crisis. *
That's right. Exactly.... *
20 INT. BREIVIK’S BEDROOM - MOTHERS APARTMENT - DAY 20 BREIVIK naked.  21 22

A police uniform laid out neatly before him, on his bed. He carefully pulls on each item of clothing. Attaches fak police insignia badges. Picks up a Glock pistol and strap to his thigh. Stands back to admire himself in the mirror. He’s ready.
VILJAR still in the seminar.
What - you’d have open borders as Prime Minister?
No. I’m just saying whether we like it or not, the world is on the move. We’re part of a global * system. Better to shape it, than * pretend to pull up drawbridges that we can’t sustain. *
Breivik’s van drives towards the centre of Oslo.
INT. BREIVIK’S VAN - CONTINUOUS 22A Breivik driving. He stops at a red traffic light. * His POV: Migrants crowded under blankets and tents. *

Breivik’s van enters the Government district. Parks behin the Office of the Prime Minister. Checks the time. Pulls out a lighter. Lights the long wir protruding from the back of the van. Puts on his black po helmet. *  23 24 25 26 27 12. As the fuse burns, he exits the van, locking the door gen He calmly walks away.
THE SECURITY GUARD sees the van on his CCTV screen. Watch the uniformed figure walk away.
(picks up phone) Hello. We got a van parked outside. Is it one of yours?

VILJAR, TORJE, SIMON and ANDERS - dressed in football kit walk down to the field below the campsite. It’s a mixed game. MOTHER UT@YA marshals crowds of TEENAG Laughter and excitement, despite the rain. As VILJAR walks out onto the pitch, sees LARA.
BREIVIK walks around a corner, and gets into the Fiat Dia
The football game in full-swing in the rain. MOTHER UT@YA referees. TORJE watching from the sideline. VILJAR at the heart of the action. Scoring.
BREIVIK drives out of Oslo. Turns on the radio.
The van parked. Unsuspecting pedestrians. Norway obliviou
SECURITY GUARD on the phone to the DVLA.
I’1ll check the number plate and I'll try to find the driver. He glances over to CCTV screen, where...
A second SECURITY GUARD is approaching the van. Suddenly: BOOM. The van explodes in a massive fireball.
INT. PM’S RESIDENCY - STUDY TO SECURE ROOM - SECONDS LATE PM goes to the window. Sees a huge tower of smoke rising the distance. Suddenly:
(enters at speed) Sir, we need you to leave. Now! His SECURITY DETAIL drag him out of the room. More guards responding.
Lock down all exits! The PM is propelled through the kitchen. Someone gives hi bullet-proof vest. Down a stairwell.
Was it a bomb??  32 33 34 14.
A massive explosion in the government district. That’s all we know.
Get the doors open! Through a set of doors and into a bare situation room.
(into radio) PM secure. The doors close. The PM protected, but powerless.
Government quarter devastated. Smoke, debris, paper casca through the air. A gaping hole in the ground where Breivi van was parked. And from every direction the sound of sirens and screamin
LIPPESTAD and SIGNE docking in Oslo Harbour, looking at a huge column of smoke rising above the city.
What is that?? On LIPPESTAD. He looks down at REBEKAH.
Let’s get in the car.
BREIVIK approaches the tunnel heading west out of the cit
Blood-stained victims emerge. People screaming. Bodies on ground. * Police start to arrive. Staggered by the scale of the destruction.
INT. PM’S RESIDENCY- SECURE ROOM - SAME TIME 36 Chaos as the SECURE ROOM begins to fill with AIDES. The P watches news coverage. *
(holding a phone) The whole quarter has been destroyed. The Prime Minister's Office, Supreme Court, Justice Ministry.
It’s bad. Bring up news of the explosion breaks on TV.
Is this gas? A gas explosion? *
That’s not a gas explosion, that’s * a bomb. It’s got to be a bomb. * On PM as he surveys pictures of the damage. On air * speculation about the status of the government. *
(enters, to comms) Can we get an update on security at the Residency please? *

This is obviously a terrorist * attack. We need to secure * government. Call the cabinet. I want the Police Director, the Head of Defense and the PST. Get in contact with them now. And then we need to inform the King: The Prime Minister is safe, the government is functioning.  37 38 39 16.
Yes, sir.
BREIVIK’s van comes out the tunnel.
We’re getting reports of an * explosion in central Oslo... See BREIVIK. He looks down at his GPS. His destination: U ISLAND.
VILJAR with TORJE, returning from the football. They see TEENAGERS by their tents, on their phones. Concerned face
What’s going on?
An explosion in Oslo. Everyone's * been called to the canteen. * VILJAR checks his phone as they head towards the building
We follow VILJAR and TORJE into the crowded canteen. SIMO and ANDERS too. Across the room: LARA and her sister BANO

Quiet please! I’m going to shout because the microphone is down... Room becomes still. As you’ve probably heard, there’s been an explosion in Oslo, in the government district. We don’t know yet what caused it, but many of you have parents who work there, so you should probably call them, if you haven't already.  40 17. TORJE looks up at VILJAR.
In the meantime, we're suspending activities until we know what's going on. VILJAR pulls out his phone. Starts to dial. As kids quest MOTHER UTOYA.
We will tell you as soon as we know more. Now please don’t worry. This is Utoya - you’re safe here.
(into phone) Mum?
VILJAR’S PARENTS, CHRISTIN and SVEINN (30) emerge from a hotel door. The sound of sirens in the distance. Ahead of them, PEOPLE hurrying towards government centre. POLICE C passing.
(on phone) Hi, I’m fine. Dad’s with me. We’re at the hotel. We’re fine.
(looking at his phone) They're saying it’s an explosion.
Dad says it’s some kind of explosion.
Was it a bomb?
We don’t know.
It looks like it’s over by the government centre.
Are you both OK?
4l 4l1A
We're fine. Torje’s a bit scared but I’11 look after him.

Ok listen, well look there’s no need to worry. Whatever it is the police are dealing with it. We'll call you when we know what’s going on. OK? 18. She hangs up, as they keep walking towards whatever has happened. More EMERGENCY VEHICLES pass by.
They’re ok?
They're fine. They walk on.
Viljar hangs up.
(to Torje) They're fine. Mum says they’re nowhere near. Lets go and get some dry clothes. He smiles, ruffling his little brother’s hair.
4l
CHRISTIN and SVEINN keep walking towards whatever has happened. More EMERGENCY VEHICLES pass by.
(dialing again) Everyone’s down at Labour HQ for the campaign meeting. Everyone.
You should call them.

(phone answers) Lena? Are you OK? What’s happened? (listens, then to Sveinn) Sounds like the whole government centre’s been hit. (into phone) Have you heard from Erik and the others? ...OK. I’m going there now. Call me if you hear anything. Yes. Cancel all of today’s meetings. They walk on.
INT. BREIVIK’S MOTHERS APARTMENT - SAME TIME 42 BREIVIK’S MOTHER watches rolling news coverage of the bom She goes into Breivik’s bedroom. Looks around. Calls his mobile.

BREIVIK driving. His phone rings: “Mother”. He doesn’t answer. Up ahead, a sign to UT@YA ISLAND. He takes the exit. Rounds a bend to reveal the beauty of TYRIFJORDEN. UT#YA ISLAND in the middle. He parks. Takes a pill. Sees a COUPLE of TEENAGE VOLUNTEE in a high-vis jackets, standing by the jetty.
(approaching) Hi, I’m Martin Nilsen from OSLO P.D. There’s been a bomb in the city. I’ve been sent to secure the island.
They cancelled the ferry.
MOTHER UT@YA is speaking to a huddle of TEENAGERS, trying lighten the mood. TROND next to her. A call to her radio:
There’s a policeman here who says he needs to come over. It’s about the bomb.
(to the guard) Ok, I’m coming. (to TROND) You stay here, I'll go and get him.
BREIVIK sees the FERRY leaving the island.
MOTHER UT@YA on the foredeck. Sees the mainland.
BREIVIK watching the boat get closer.
48 As the ferry ramp lowers, MOTHER UT@YA sees BREIVIK clear for the first time. He’s heavily armed and wearing what l like a black combat suit.
Hi, I’m Monica, I’m in charge. What’s going on?
Martin Nilsen. Oslo Police Department. I need you to take me to the island. Get everyone together and I’1l give a debrief about the bomb.
Everyone?
Yes, everyone. It’s important. +e
What are the cases for?
My weapons.
Well you need to keep them covered up. They’1ll scare the children.
Of course. They start back towards the island.
TROND gets a call.
The policeman wants everyone to gather in the middle of the island... Trond, can you meet us? TROND, walks down to meet them.
The ferry docks. MOTHER UT@YA and BREIVIK disembark.
(to Breivik) This is Trond Berntsen, our head of security here on the island. BREIVIK shakes hands.
Martin Nilsen. Oslo PD. They sent me to secure the island.
Well no-one called us.
Everyone’s needed in Oslo. It’s chaos down there. You should see it. They start to walk up the hill.
(something about this not right) So which precinct are you from?
PST. Police Security Service.
So you must know Jern then? Isn’t he down at PST?

J@rn? Sure. He’s one of my superiors. Breivik (CONT'D) Is everyone gathered up there for the debrief? Monica We're calling them in now. Trond stops. A moment between them. Who’s lying here? TronD Do you mind. Can I see your ID again?
Sure. Suddenly, BREIVIK pulls out the Glock.
Don’t! BANG! BANG! TROND falls. Then he turns the gun on MOTHER UTOYA.
Tight on VILJAR, as the sound of gunfire reverberates acr the island. Around him TEENAGERS emerge from their tents. Confused lo
BREIVIK on the move. Up the slope. Towards the campsite.
More cracks. Closer this time.
I'll go and see what’s happening.
BREIVIK still coming. Fast.
EXT. Campsite - SAME TIME 51D VILJAR watching ANDERS walk up towards the canteen. More bangs. The sound of screaming on the wind.
(to Torje) It’s okay, it’s just kids messing..
BREIVIK approaching the top of the rise.
VILJAR sees in the distance screaming TEENAGERS running towards their car. And behind them, BREIVIK cresting the hill. A moment suspended in time... as he raises his gun.
(realising)
VILJAR grabs TORJE and runs, as BREIVIK opens fire.
Viljar’s PARENTS, CHRISTIN and SVEINN, arrive at a corner just down from government centre. POLICE CARS, AMBULANCES CROWDS milling around. Chaos.
(approaches a police officer) Was it a bomb?
Move back! You have to move back!
Excuse me. Excuse me, Sir. I need to see my colleagues. We’re supposed to be having a campaign meeting. At Labour Party headquarter.
Please move back! You can’t come through. We’re clearing this area.
Can you at least tell me which buildings have been hit?
We don’t know. You just need to move back. Please. Suddenly her phone rings... The sound of screaming, running, and the phone being fumb through hands.

Viljar?
Mum, they’re shooting at us!
Viljar?? What’s-— The phone line goes dead.
What is it?
(trying to call them back) It was Viljar. He said someone was shooting at them.
Shooting? What do you mean shooting?
He just said there was shooting and hung up.
Try him back.
(dialing) I’m calling him...
Shooting what? What did he say exactly?
It was really quick. He definitely said shooting. (listens) It’s going to voicemail.
Just someone is shooting?
(trying phone again) At us. He said: Mum. Someone’s shooting at us. Quietly. Just like that. That was it. +e
(checking his phone too) Did he sound frightened?
Yes. I heard gunshots. They look at the chaos in front of them.
Gunshots? We need to get down there. They push their way through the chaos and start running t their car.
EXT. UT@YA ISLAND - LOVER’S PATH - SAME TIME 53 Back to VILJAR and TORJE, running into the woods. Panic. Hundreds of TEENAGERS. Gunfire, screaming behind them.
BREIVIK approaches the main building.
(Sees faces at the window) It’s okay. Police. I’ve got it under control. Stay there and I’1l come and help you. He goes into the building.
BREIVIK down a corridor.
As dozens of TEENAGERS crouch in corners. Waiting to be saved. BREIVIK enters. Sees them. Raises his gun.
The sound of gunfire and screaming from inside.

EXT. UTOYA ISLAND - LOVER’S PATH - SAME TIME 58 VILJAR and TORJE running. Looking for somewhere - anywher to hide. VILJAR sees a break in a fence. They tumble down a muddy bank. Scramble sideways onto a ledge. A dead end. Below t an 8ft drop to the lake. They’re trapped. Other TEENAGERS crawl onto the ledge behind them.
BREIVIK leaves the canteen. Crosses the campsite.
VILJAR and TORJE crammed together on the ledge. The shoot getting louder. He sees SIMON. But no ANDERS.
Torje, look at me. Look at me. TORJE tears streaming down face.
It’s going to be ok..

BREIVIK down the path. Sees the gap in the fence ahead. Climbs through it. Sees them all clustered on the ledge. Lifts his gun... He opens fire. PEOPLE falling. Panic. Screaming. VILJAR and TORJE jump.  62 28. They land on rocks at the water’s edge and scramble for cover. BREIVIK shoots again. Simon hit. Two others as well. And then VILJAR is hit. He struggles back up, holding his shoulder. Another shot, he falls again. Another, still he keeps going. Desperately struggling to escape. And another. And then one last impact punctures his skull. TORJE turns back to see his brother fall. VILJAR sees TORJE coming back for him.
Go Mustering all his remaining strength he splashes water at TORJE.
Go! TORJE turns and throws himself forward into cover. Through a haze of blood, he sees the dark figure looming above him on the clifftop, before he turns away into the trees.
A lone SWITCHBOARD OPERATOR. A quiet room. A red light on her switchboard begins to flash.

(answering) What’s your emergency- The sound of screaming down the end of the phone. Then it cuts.  29. SWITCHBOARD OPERATOR (CONT’D) Hello? The SWITCHBOARD OPERATOR puts down the phone. Almost immediately, another red light. SWITCHBOARD OPERATOR (CONT’D) Police emergency-
Help us! Please
(struggling to hear) Hello? Hello? The line goes dead again. Beat. Suddenly: all the lights on the switchboard turn red.
HONEFOSS POLICEMAN #1 and his team scrambling to Utoya. *
Multiple reports of gunfire on Ut@ya Island...
On our way. What’s the RV point?
Follow behind SECURITY OFFICIAL LARS on the phone as he * approaches the PM - who is standing, watching news covera surrounded by several AIDES.
(holding phone) Sir, we may have another attack. We've just had reports of gunfire on Ut@ya Island. +e
What? Utoya?  30.
We're just getting details now. *
But we have hundreds of kids down there. It’s the summer camp.
(also on phone) Local police are responding. But everything else, DELTA, it’s all here in the city. Dealing with the bomb. +e
Get on to the Police Director. Tell him to get everything they can down there. Now! *
We're on it. * End on shot of monitor. *
HONEFOSS POLICEMAN #1 in his car. Blue lights, sirens.
(over radio) Assumed terror attack. Possible multiple shooters. DELTA are en- * route and will assume site command. * Uteya Island comes into sight.
Understood.
CHRISTIN and SVEINN driving towards Uteya. * CHRISTIN keeps trying Viljar’s phone, turns on the radio.  66 67 68 69 70 31.
We’re getting unconfirmed reports * of shooting on Utgya Island, at the * Labour Youth summer camp.. *
GEIR LIPPESTAD and family driving towards the centre of O Smoke clearly visible. Ambulances screech past. Police ca All away from the bomb site.
What the hell is going on?
BREIVIK in tight close-up moving across the island. Killi methodically. Relentlessly. He launches a smoke grenade. Acrid orange smoke billows.

VILJAR lying on the rocks. Screaming and gunfire in the distance. The sounds of sobbing and pain nearby. He uses his uninjured hand to touch his wounds. Too many stem the loss of blood. He reaches his head. Feels the flesh of his exposed brain
TORJE reaches the shadow of the cliffs. KIDS hiding, * including LARA. He looks to the mainland - it’s too far. Sudden gunfire above him. He recoils into the rock. *

HONEFOSS POLICEMAN #1 takes the turning for Uteya. Down t steep slope. Sees Utgya ahead in the distance.  71 32. He pulls up at the jetty. He gets out and looks over to U Island. In the distance: dirty orange smoke billowing through the pine trees. Volleys of gunfire echoing across the water. Figures in the lake desperately swimming for their lives. My God...
Where are the boats??
DELTA have them. The RV is Storgya.
Storgya?? But that’s a mile away! HONEFOSS POLICEMAN#1 sprints back to his car. Knows time means lives.
BREIVIK sees the POLICE on the mainland. Sees a discarded mobile phone. Dials...
Police Emergency Line...
Hi. This is Anders Behring Breivik. * I am a Commander in the Norwegian * Anti-Communist Resistance Movement. *
Who?
Anders Behring Breivik. I’m on * Uteya. I’ve just finished my * operation and I would like to give * myself up.
Uteya? * The line cuts. BREIVIK drops the phone. Moves on towards targets.  72 73 33. We see that this is all part of his plan.
CHRISTIN and SVEINN speeding to UTOYA. The lake comes into view. And a police roadblock. SVEINN slams on the brakes. They get out of car. The sound of gunfire in the distance.
My children are on the island! You've got to let me through.

You can’t Ma’‘am. This is an active situation. It’s not safe. Suddenly, POLICE vehicles approach at high speed. Then ambulances. As they roar past, CHRISTIN makes a break for it on foot. ROADBLOCK POLICEMAN (CONT’D) Please, you’re not helping! The POLICEMAN follows. Catches her.
Christin. Christin! No.. He takes her back to the car.
We'll find another way through. He pulls a hard U-turn and they speed back the way they c
VILJAR lies helpless. Gunfire in the distance. He moves h head. Sees the outline of lifeless bodies.
(calling out) Simon?... Anders? Nothing.
HONEFOSS POLICEMAN #1 arrives at RV point. DELTA UNITS arriving. The sound of distant gunfire throughout.
Unit A to the south end of the island, B to the north. (NB Correct terminology tbc) A police RHIB is frantically deployed. But it’s overloade The engine cuts out.
Shit! He spots a civilian boat approaching. OFFICERS unload int it. More precious moments wasted.
A handful of leisure boats speed away from the mainland * towards the island. *
BREVIK sees them coming.
So does TORJE. * As they approach, he throws himself into the water and sw out from the cover of the cliffs, towards them. *
BREIVIK sees TORJE. Opens fire. The tourist boat swerves. TORJE disappears under the surface. Swimming for his life
HONEFOSS POLICEMAN #1 behind the wheel of the second boat Feels the engine straining. Willing it forward. The sound of gunfire ahead.

TORJE still swimming. The sound of an engine behind him. He turns to see a seco boat, the DRIVER waving frantically. TORJE is pulled onboard.
(as the boat speeds away) No. Wait. We have to go back for my brother! More gunfire.

VILJAR fighting to stay awake. He starts to sing...
HONEFOSS POLICEMAN #1 speeds towards the island and catch glimpse of BREIVIK in the trees.
One shooter. Two o’clock.

83 36. EXT/INT. LIPPESTAD’S HOME. DAY 82B LIPPESTAD and FAMILY pull up outside their home. LIPPESTAD unloads REBEKAH from the car, as SIGNE ferries other kids inside. We follow them in. (listens) I’1l standby. She hangs up. SIGNE (CONT’D) (to LIPPESTAD) They're calling everyone in. They’11l let me know as soon as they've designated a hospital. LIPPESTAD nods as she runs upstairs.
The PM on a conference call. Grappling to make sense of t unfolding attack.
Are DELTA on the island yet? Where the hell are they?
Activate mass casualty protocols. Repeat activate mass casualty protocols. I want every hospital on standby.
